segments.text: I see a woman completely absorbed in drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus is so intense that she doesn’t even notice the water spilling over the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me a bit nervous, seeing that puddle growing at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy climbing on that rickety stool—what is he thinking?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He stretches for that cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl stands there, waiting eagerly with her hand out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a little annoyed at how reckless they’re being.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a recipe for disaster, yet it’s so ordinary.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden looks so peaceful, contrasting with the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think that if the woman just looked around for a moment, she’d realize what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR
